title: Matchsafe, "Smiling Female", ca. 1902
markings: Unidentified maker's mark, STERLING 4123 stamped on reverse bezel.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Oblong, rounded corners, sides bulge slightly, pinched at point where lid meets box body, small dip at lid's top and bottom edges, as well as at bottom of box, continuous groove around box sides. Front features raised image of long, bare necked, smiling female bust, head tilted towards sleeved right shoulder, with hair that curls around her face and in longer, upward swirls on lid section. Undecorated reverse inscribed "From The New York Times, in grateful appreciation of friendly aid, November 8th, 1902", monogram, possibly "OR", inscribed on lid. Lid hinged on side, striker on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Smiling Female", ca. 1902.
ca. 1902. Silver. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-376.
